body.name: Grimgar of Fantasy and Ash (Light Novel) Vol. 6
editorialReviews: Editorial Reviews About the Author Ao Jyumonji is a Japanese author best known for the Grimgar of Fantasy and Ash light novels. Eiri Shirai is a Japanese manga artist best known for the illustrations in Grimgar of Fantasy and Ash.
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Thursday, February 22 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 13 hrs 32 mins
body.description: WHAT DO YOU MEAN, WE’RE TURNING BACK? The Dusk Realm has begun to attract attention as a new hunting ground. However, all is not well–there’s been a rise in cultist and white giant activity, and massive new monsters have emerged! Together with Soma, the head of the Day Breakers, Haruhiro and the Tokkis get caught up in large-scale military offensive against the inhabitants of the Dusk Realm. Can they make it back to the Day Realm–and if the way is cut off, where will they go? Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Even though the anime adaption hasn't picked up the second season, I still find myself wanting to know what happened next. I got into grimgar fantasy and ash from the anime adaption. Believe it or not it's the reason why I started to read more books these days.Highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wow, I really need the next volume
reviews.reviewText: Screw what I said last time, this volume was so anxiety inducing. So many things could have went wrong for the goblin slayers and the tokkis. The ending kind of ended on a bit of a cliff hanger, in a position that left me thinking "they are so screwed." Besides the story the book itself came in pretty good condition. The only problem I have is the adhesive that came from most likely an old sticker is tough to get off. But honestly I'm cool with that, I gotta have volume 7 though.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Different from other volumes
reviews.reviewText: This volume was a bit different from the rest. It was not focused so much on the main characters. As it was in other parties and how they view them. It has an interesting plot twist at the end and I’m not sure what I should expect from here on.Only bad thing is I had hoped the MCs would grow a bit on their skills every volume. Didn’t see that in these vol. It was more of a psychological/tactical growth!?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars More character development, more action!
reviews.reviewText: The story just keeps getting better and better! I love the way Haru and the group are progressing. Haru is becoming a great leader, even if he doesn't know it. The party's teamwork is better than ever. It's alright that they aren't on par with the greatest of the greats, their still awesome in my book. I love how nearly 1/4 of this book is one big brawl, kind of like the raid in one of the previous volumes. It just goes to show battles aren't won or lost in an instant. The author does a great job of showing the flow of the battle, and the turning points.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Progress and Intrigue!
reviews.reviewText: Volume 6 picks up where we left off in the Dusk Realm with a few new surprises, plot progression, and interesting character developments. It was an enjoyable read and worth the wait, but oh the torture of waiting until January for the next novel!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love this intercut story and how the characters progress in ...
reviews.reviewText: Love this intercut story and how the characters progress in their development and understanding of this world and the people they interact with

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2017
reviews.reviewText: As all the other books this too is entertaining. I feel the progress in the story is increasing and this adds more interest.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2018
reviews.reviewText: A continuation of the adventures of Haruhiro and friends in the dusk realm, it’s nice to see their progression from goblins to cultists. It’s also great to see the actions among the higher teams such as Soma’s Daybreakers and Akira’s group. Parts of me wish to see more growth within the group especially with Yume, Merry and Shihoru. But I’m starting to grow fond of their relationship with the Tokkis. If you are liking the Grimgar series this book serves as a good sequel front the last novel.

reviews.reviewTitle: Left me with desire to read more.
reviews.reviewText: I want to see the power level of the daybreakers adapted into animation, can't wait to see these battles in 4k if possible.

reviews.reviewTitle: Todo RPG que se preze tem isso!
reviews.reviewText: Todo bom e velho rpg tem que ter personagens épicos pelos quais os jogadores se inspiram e querem se igualar, em Grimgar não é diferentes e nesse volume 6 o autor fez questão de mesclar esse aspecto da apresentação de personagens lendários com batalhas em níveis épicos. Como sempre a percepção de Haruhiro é sem "hype", ou seja, pé no chão, seja em relação a outros aventureiros ou seja em relação ao potencial do seu grupo, mas isso que o faz ser carismático, pois ele é um "loser" consciente e carismático :).
In the Dusk Realm Haruhiro and the gang continue their story and learn skills in a new large volunteer soldier campaign.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 13, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: The story is good and the book arrived in good condition
reviews.reviewText: I very much enjoy the series and can't wait for the other volumes to come out. I would definitely buy again and future volumes.
